Section Rock Gabion Baskets Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for Rock gabion baskets of twisted or welded wire mesh .
Materials .
General Provide wire mesh Material free of breaks in the wire breaks at weld points or other deficiencies .
Individual wires of either style mesh shall meet the following minimum requirements Galvanizing .
oz .
per sq .
ft. minimum Tensile strength psi minimum Wire diameter tolerance limit .
Tensile area includes galvanizing Welded wire shall also conform to AASHTO M ASTM A except that the weld shears shall be pounds for gauge and pounds for gauge wires .
All wire sizes are after galvanizing .
Tie wires and internal connecting wires shall be galvanized and no smaller than gauge .
Spiral binders may be used as an alternate to tie wire for basket assembly and baskettobasket connections .
Spiral binders shall be gauge galvanized and have a inch pitch .
High tensile fasteners of the locking spring steel clip or clampon ring type may be used as alternates to tie wire for basket assembly only .
High tensile fasteners shall be fabricated from gauge steel wire with a minimum tensile strength of psi .
Provide a Class zinc coating according to ASTM A .
High tensile fasteners shall provide a closed position tensile strength of pounds .
All wire shall be galvanized according to ASTM A. .
Twisted Wire Mesh Gabion Baskets Furnish gabion panels of the twisted mesh style manufactured from gauge with gauge selvage wires .
The mesh shall form a uniform hexagonal pattern and shall be formed with a nonraveling twist .
The major axis maximum line dimensions of any hexagonal opening shall not exceed .
inches .
The area of the hexagonal opening approximately .
inches by .
inches shall not exceed .
square inches. . Welded Wire Mesh Gabion Baskets Furnish gabion panels of the welded mesh style manufactured from gauge or gauge wire .
The mesh shall form a nominal inch by inch grid pattern and conform to AASHTO M ASTM A .
The maximum line dimension of any opening shall not exceed .
inches .
The inch and inch high mattresses shall be made from gauge panels .
Gabions of square Cross Section cubicalcelled units may be made with either gauge or gauge panels except that within the same unit panels of dissimilar wire sizes may not be mixed .
Galvanized gauge stiffeners placed diagonally in the baskets at the vertical onethird points as shown on the Plans or as recommended by the manufacturer may be used instead of perpendicular cross ties. . PVC Coated Wire Mesh Gabion Baskets The wire type used for PVC coated wire mesh gabions shall be either twisted wire mesh or welded wire mesh and shall conform to .
and .
or .. .
The PVC coating for twisted wire mesh gabions shall be extruded onto the wire core before weaving the coated wire into a double twisted hexagonal mesh .
The use and minimum diameter of the various wires is as follows Gabion Panel wire core shall be manufactured from galvanized gauge wire core .
The overall minimum diameter of the galvanized wire core plus PVC coating shall be .
inch .
Selvage and reinforcing wire shall be of heavily galvanized gauge wire core coated with PVC and having an overall minimum diameter galvanized wire core plus PVC coating of .
inch .
Lacing and connecting wire shall be of heavily galvanized gauge wire core coated with PVC and having an overall minimum diameter galvanized wire core plus PVC coating of .
inch . .
Fabrication Fabricate gabions so that the sides ends lid and diaphragms can be assembled at the construction site into rectangular baskets of the specified sizes .
Dimensions for heights lengths and widths of gabion baskets shall be as indicated on the Plans with a tolerance of plus or minus percent .
Gabions shall be of single unit construction .
Either connect the base lid ends and sides into a single unit or connect one edge of these members to the base section of the gabion in such a manner that strength and flexibility at the point of connection are at least equal to those of the mesh .
If the length of the gabion exceeds its horizontal width equally divide the gabion by diaphragms into cells whose length does not exceed the horizontal width .
The diaphragm material shall be of the same mesh and size as the body of the gabions .
Furnish the gabion with the necessary diaphragms secured in proper position on the base in such manner that no additional tying at this juncture will be necessary .
Assemble the wire mesh panels base ends sides diaphragms and lid so strength and flexibility at connections are at least equal to those of a single panel . .
Acceptance Provide a quality compliance certificate for gabion baskets according to .. .
Section Metal Bin Retaining Walls Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for galvanized steel sheets and hardware for the assembly of metal bin retaining walls .
Materials .
Base Metal Galvanizing and Thickness Design all members fittings and appurtenances as integral units or parts of the whole assembly .
The galvanized sheets used in fabricating the members shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M . Bolts nuts and miscellaneous hardware shall be galvanized or otherwise protected with approved coatings and shall be of sizes and shapes suitable for use with the members furnished .
Fabricate the members from the specified base metal of the thickness shown .
In the absence of given thickness or dimensions for any member fitting or appurtenance the thickness of metal or dimensions of the member shall be as required to fully develop the strength of the members whose thickness and dimensions are given and which are used in structural combination . .
Fabrication Fabricate all members so members of the same nominal size are fully interchangeable .
Fabricate and punch the members so no drilling punching or drifting to correct defects in manufacture will be required during field assembly .
Any members having improperly punched holes will be rejected .
Replace with a member with properly punched holes. . Drainage and Water Distribution Materials Section Concrete Pipe Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for nonreinforced and reinforced concrete pipe and concrete drain pipe and tile .
Materials .
Concrete Pipe Furnish concrete pipe meeting the following requirements a End Designs Where rubber gasket joints are used modify the design of the ends of the pipe sections according to AASHTO M to accommodate rubber gaskets .
b Sloped or Skewed Ends If the ends of pipe require sloped ends skewed ends or both fabricate the ends in a manner that provides good workmanship and a smooth finish and protection to otherwise exposed reinforcement where applicable .
c Markings Indent the markings required by AASHTO M ASTM C in the outside surface of each section of pipe .
d Concrete Pipe Field Permeability Tests The Engineer may require field permeability tests on a maximum of percent of each lot class or size of pipe according to ASTM C on pipe inches in diameter and smaller .
Provide all the necessary labor Equipment water and Materials at the site for performing field permeability tests .
At the option of the pipe Supplier and with the approval of the Engineer individual field permeability tests may be performed at the point of manufacture .
e Concrete Pipe Plant Air Test The Engineer may require that each length of concrete pipe inches in diameter and smaller be given an individual air test at the point of manufacture .
Use test Equipment approved by the Engineer and a test pressure of at least of psi .
Each length shall show no appreciable loss of air after seconds .
When individual air testing is performed no field or shop permeability tests will be required .
f Nonreinforced Concrete Pipe Provide nonreinforced or plain circular concrete pipe and special sections conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM C or ASTM C and this Section .
g Reinforced Concrete Pipe Provide reinforced concrete pipe and special sections conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM C and this Section except as follows .
Special Sections Furnish special sections such as elbows wyes tees crosses bends and reducers as shown specified or directed .
In the absence of any design or Specifications the special sections shall be of the design recommended by the manufacturer for the intended use .
Generally the special sections shall conform to the requirements specified for the pipe with which it is to be used. . Fabricate special sections with components from tested and approved lots .
Maintain production dates of components .
Load Strength Reinforced concrete pipe having the same Dload strengths as those specified to be furnished under AASHTO M ASTM C may be furnished according to AASHTO M ASTM C. Acceptance The basis of acceptance for reinforced concrete pipe manufactured according to AASHTO M ASTM C and AASHTO M ASTM C will be Paragraph .. of AASHTO M . h Concrete Drain Pipe Use circular nonreinforced perforated concrete pipe and special sections for subsurface drainage conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM C Type all applicable requirements of AASHTO M ASTM C except indent the markings required by AASHTO M ASTM C in the outside surface of each section of pipe .
i Concrete Drain Tile Provide concrete drain tile conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM C. .
Acceptance Except as provided in .g acceptance of nonreinforced concrete pipe reinforced concrete pipe concrete drain pipe concrete drain tile and hardware will be according to .
and this Section . .
Section Plastic Pipe Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for polyethylene pipe polypropylene pipe and polyvinyl chloride pipe. . Definitions Corrugated Polyethylene Pipe Pipe that is extruded to form a smooth inner wall and a corrugated external wall .
The corrugations are hollow .
Polyethylene Pipe Pipe using high density polyethylene HDPE resins are included in three specific subcategories corrugated solidwall and steelreinforced .
SolidWall Polyethylene Pipe Pipe that is extruded to form a solid pipe wall .
The joint may be either butt fused or bell and spigot .
Steel Reinforced Polyethylene Pipe Pipe that is extruded to form a smooth inner wall and a corrugated external wall .
The corrugations are solid and contain a continuous steel reinforcement band .
Materials .
Corrugated Polyethylene Pipe Furnish corrugated polyethylene pipe meeting the following requirements and listed in the QPL Corrugated polyethylene drain pipe AASHTO M Corrugated polyethylene culvert pipe AASHTO M Type S or D Corrugated polyethylene storm sewer pipe AASHTO M Type S or D The allowable nominal inside diameter of corrugated polyethylene pipe is as follows Corrugated polyethylene drain pipe Up to Corrugated polyethylene culvert pipe Corrugated polyethylene storm sewer pipe Furnish watertight joints for corrugated polyethylene pipe meeting the requirements of ASTM D and be listed in the QPL. . SolidWall Polyethylene Pipe Furnish solidwall polyethylene pipe and fittings from the QPL or that meet the following requirements Resin that has a hydrostatic design basis HDB of psi when tested and analyzed according to ASTM D and has a material designation code of PE or PE as listed by the Plastic Pipe Institute .
Resin meeting the requirements of ASTM D and has a minimum cell classification of PEC Code D or E may also be used for pipe bursting and lining pipe and for slip lining pipe .
The pipe does not contain recycled compound except that generated in the manufacturers own plant from resin of the same specification from the same raw material pipe .
Do not recycle pipe excluding black colored pipe that is stored outside .
Pipe and fittings meeting the requirements of ASTM F and ASTM D as modified for the specified material. . With legible markings by the pipe manufacturer with the following information ASTM designation number The letters PE followed by the material designation code Nominal pipe size Dimension ratio Name and trademark of manufacturer Production code from which the date and place of manufacture can be determined .
Steel Reinforced Polyethylene Pipe Furnish steel reinforced polyethylene pipe meeting the following requirements and be listed on the QPL Steel reinforced polyethylene culvert pipe ASTM F Steel reinforced polyethylene storm sewer pipe ASTM F The allowable nominal inside diameter of steel reinforced polyethylene pipe is as follows Steel reinforced polyethylene culvert pipe Steel reinforced polyethylene storm sewer pipe Furnish steel reinforced polyethylene pipe joints and gaskets meeting the following requirements Bell and spigot couplings ASTM D Elastomeric gaskets ASTM F For steel reinforced polyethylene pipe provide either factory installed gaskets on the couplings or manufacturer installed gaskets on the pipes .
Provide at least silt tight joints for culvert pipe and water tight joints for storm sewer pipe .
Provide watertight joints meeting the requirements of ASTM D and be listed in the QPL . .
Polypropylene Pipe Furnish polypropylene pipe and fittings meeting the following requirements and listed in the QPL Dual wall polypropylene pipe and fittings ASTM F Triple wall polypropylene pipe and fittings ASTM F Watertight joints ASTM D The allowable nominal inside diameter of polypropylene pipe is as follows Dual wall polypropylene pipe Triple wall polypropylene pipe .
Polyvinyl Chloride Pipe Furnish polyvinyl chloride pipe PVC subsurface drain pipe and fittings meeting the requirements of ASTM D. Furnish PVC sanitary storm culvert siphon and irrigation pipe and fittings with feet or more cover that have a minimum pipe stiffness of psi or a minimum SDR of and meet the requirements of sewer pipe ASTM D ASTM F or ASTM F. Furnish PVC sanitary storm culvert siphon and irrigation pipe and fittings with less than feet but at least foot cover meeting the requirements of AWWA C or AWWA C . .
Acceptance Acceptance of polyethylene pipe polypropylene pipe polyvinyl chloride pipe and hardware will be according to .
and this Section . .
Section Metal Pipe Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for corrugated steel pipe helical rib pipe arch type pipe aluminum pipe ductile iron pipe and special sections intended for use for storm drainage underdrains and culverts and not intended for the conveyance of sanitary or industrial waste .
Materials .
Corrugated Steel Pipe and Pipe Arches Furnish corrugated steel pipe helical rib pipe pipe arches and special sections meeting the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A Types I IA and II except as follows a Shapes Provide either fullcircle or elliptical pipe as the Contractor may elect unless otherwise shown or specified .
The shapes of pipe fabricated and furnished may include any of the following FullCircle Pipe Fabricate helical rib pipe in fullcircle Cross Section only .
ArchType Pipe Elliptical Pipe Fullcircle pipe distorted percent outofround by shop fabrication to form an elliptical Cross Section with the major axis vertical .
HalfCircle Pipe Fabricate as half sections of fullcircle pipe of the same diameter .
Nestable Pipe Fabricate in two separate half sections designed to fit and fasten together to form a fullcircle Cross Section of specified diameter .
Fasten the two half sections together by approved means which shall provide at least percent of the strength of a standard riveted longitudinal seam .
b Connecting Bands Use connecting bands conforming to the details shown on the Plans to make field joints for pipes and pipe arches not requiring watertight joints .
c Special Sections Furnish special sections such as elbows wyes tees crosses bends reducers and flared inlets as shown or as directed .
Generally special sections shall conform to the requirements specified for the pipe with which they are used and shall be connected to the pipe or to each other with connecting bands specified for use with the pipe to which they are connected .
For elbows of or greater total angle use threepiece sections of approximately equal length and equalangle segments or pieces .
Weld joints according to recognized standard practice and repair any damaged zinc or aluminum coating according to .d .
d Repair of Damaged Coating In addition to the methods given in AASHTO M ASTM A the Contractor may repair damaged zinc or aluminum coating by removing all loose or cracked coating removing all welding flux wire brushing the damaged area and applying two coats minimum mils total thickness of a high zinc dust content paint conforming to the general requirements of ASTM A. . Damaged zinc or aluminum coating within inch of the ends of pipe sections caused by production cutoff of pipe need not be repaired .
Coating damage on edges of connecting bands need not be repaired .
e Irrigation Pipe In irrigation pipe installations where Type D coating AASHTO M is not specified the Contractor will be allowed to furnish pipe with Type D coating .
Riveted Seams If pipes are not furnished with Type D coating do the following Place a bead or strip of approved caulking compound inch minimum diameter or thickness between the laps of all riveted seams .
Rivet the annular seams of riveted pipe at spacings not greater than inches .
Rivet in a single row the longitudinal seams of pipes less than inches in diameter .
Place one rivet in each valley and one on each crest of the corrugations .
Double rivet the longitudinal seams of pipes inches and larger in diameter in each valley of the corrugations and place a single rivet on each crest of the corrugations .
At the intersection of longitudinal and circumferential seams close the gap caused by the threesheet lap by special fabrication .
Fabricate a special longitudinal seam at the ends of pipe sections for a sufficient distance to clear the coupling bands .
Spot welding of the seams of corrugated metal pipe used in irrigation pipe installations will not be allowed .
Field Joints Use connecting bands conforming to the details shown and make the field joints watertight .
f Siphon Pipe Fabricate corrugated steel pipe used in siphons with watertight seams .
Field joints shall provide circumferential and longitudinal strength to preserve the pipe alignment prevent separation of pipe sections and provide a watertight joint .
Attach the connecting bands so they lap a nearly equal portion of each pipe section to be connected .
g Sloped or Skewed Ends If the ends of pipe culverts require sloped ends skewed ends or both fabricate the ends in a manner that provides good workmanship and a smooth finish .
Restore zinc or aluminum coating as directed according to .d and bituminous protective coatings and linings when specified. . Ductile Iron Furnish ductile iron pipe conforming to the requirements of AWWA C. Use Pressure Class or Special Thickness Class as directed . .
Protective Coatings If specified or shown furnish corrugated metal pipes with protective coatings as follows a Bituminous Protective Coatings Provide corrugated metal pipe and connecting bands with bituminous coatings conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M and the following Before immersion the metal shall be free of grease dirt dust moisture or other contaminants .
Apply the initial bituminous coating by one of the processes under .a or .a .
If a second dip is required to meet the coating thickness requirements of AASHTO M the time and temperature requirements of .a or .a need not be followed for the second dip . .
The paved invert for both Type B and Type C coatings on either circular or arch type pipe shall fill the corrugations for at least percent of the circumference of the pipe .
Pipe Not Preheated The temperature of the asphalt at the time of pipe immersion shall be F F and the duration of the immersion shall conform to the following schedule Metal Thickness Inch Minimum Immersion Time Steel Aluminum Minutes .
. . . . . . . . . . . . . .
Pipe Preheated At the time of pipe immersion the asphalt shall have a temperature of F F and the pipe shall be preheated to a temperature F to F. b Type D FullyBituminous Coated FullyLined The interior lining shall be smooth uniform and free from sags and runs .
Slight residual corrugations due to cooling and shrinkage of the lining will not be cause for rejection .
At the threesheet lap an interior nonuniformity equal to the thickness of the sheet will be allowed .
Maintain the thickness of the lining to the ends of the pipe .
c Optional Paved Invert If an asphalt coated pipe with a paved invert Type C coating is shown or specified a centrifugallyapplied interior lining conforming to Type D coating may be furnished as an alternate providing the minimum thickness of bituminous coating over the crests of the corrugations is not less than inch .
d Polymeric Coatings If polymeric coating is shown on the pipe data sheet use a coating from section .
of the QPL . .
Corrugated Steel Pipe for Underdrains Furnish corrugated steel pipe for underdrains conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A Type III Underdrain Pipes except as modified in .c and .d and as follows a Class IV Semicircular pipe may be used only as an alternate with the inch size of perforated fullcircle drain pipe .
b Connecting Bands Connecting bands for underdrain pipe field joints shall conform to the designs shown . .
Corrugated Aluminum Alloy Pipe Furnish corrugated aluminum alloy pipe helical rib pipe pipe arches and special sections conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM B Types I II and III except as follows a Shapes The shapes of the pipes to be furnished may include any of the shapes described in .a .
b Connecting Bands Use connecting bands conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM B and the details shown to make field joints for pipes and pipe arches not requiring watertight joints .
c Special Sections Furnish special sections such as elbows wyes tees crosses bends reducers and flared inlets as shown or as directed. . Generally special sections shall conform to the requirements specified for the pipe with which they are used and shall be connected to the pipe or to each other with connecting bands specified for use with the pipe to which they are connected .
For elbows of or greater total angle use a threepiece section of approximately equal length and equalangle segments or pieces .
d Irrigation Pipe In irrigation pipe installations where Type D coating is not shown or specified the Contractor will be allowed to furnish pipe with Type D coating .
If pipes are not furnished with Type D coating all riveted seams shall conform to the applicable provisions of .e .
Use connecting bands conforming to AASHTO M ASTM B and the details shown and make the field joints watertight for pipe installations used in irrigation .
e Siphon Pipe Fabricate corrugated aluminum alloy pipe used in siphons with watertight seams .
Field joints shall provide circumferential and longitudinal strength to preserve the pipe alignment prevent separation of pipe sections and provide a watertight joint .
Fabricate the connecting bands from aluminum alloy conforming to AASHTO M ASTM B .
Attach the connecting bands so they lap a nearly equal portion of each pipe section to be connected .
f Sloped or Skewed Ends If the ends of pipe culverts require sloped ends skewed ends or both fabricate the ends in a manner that provides good workmanship and a smooth finish .
Repair bituminous protective coatings and linings when specified . .
Corrugated Aluminum Alloy Pipe for Underdrains Furnish corrugated aluminum alloy pipe for underdrains conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM B Type III except as follows a Special Sections The provisions of .c apply .
b Connecting Bands Connecting bands for field joints shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM B and the details shown . .
Acceptance Acceptance of pipes underdrains and protective coatings will be according to .
and this Section . .
Section Structural Plate Pipe Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for steel and aluminum alloy plates and hardware for structural plate pipe .
Materials .
Galvanized Steel Plates a General Furnish galvanized steel plates for structural plate pipe conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A. b Plates for Pipe Arches The top plates shall form an arc between and degrees .
The bottom plates shall form an arc between and degrees .
Join the top plates at each end to the bottom plates with corner plates to form an arc with a radius between inches and inches or between inches and inches as applicable and forming an arc between .
and degrees .
c Forming and Punching Plates Form plates to provide lap joints .
Punch the bolt holes so that all plates with the same dimensions curvature thickness and number of bolts per foot of seam are interchangeable .
Curve each plate to the proper radius so that the crosssectional dimensions of the finished Structure will be as shown or as specified .
Fabricate bolt holes according to AASHTO M . Provide additional bolt holes for special conditions of installation when specified or shown .
d Sloped and Skewed Ends Cut plates for forming sloped ends skewed ends or both to give the angle of Slope or skew shown .
Burnt edges shall be free from oxide and burrs .
Legibly identify each cut plate to designate its proper position in the finished Structure. . Aluminum Alloy Plates Furnish aluminum alloy plates for structural plate pipe conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM B. Fabricate according to .b through .d. . Bolts Nuts and Washers Furnish bolts nuts and washers for use with galvanized steel structural plate pipe conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A and galvanized according to AASHTO M ASTM A. Furnish bolts nuts and washers for use with aluminum alloy structural plate pipe conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM B and galvanized according to AASHTO M ASTM A. .
Acceptance Acceptance of structural plate pipe and hardware will be according to .
and this Section . .
Section Joint Materials Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for joint fillers seals gaskets and water stop for concrete pipe joints manhole section joints bridge joints and miscellaneous concrete applications .
Materials .
Preformed Joint Fillers for Concrete Furnish preformed joint fillers for concrete from the QPL conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M or AASHTO M . .
Poured Joint Sealant Furnish a twocomponent low modulus rapidcure joint sealant from the QPL . .
Backer Rod Furnish a closedcell nongassing foam material backer rod from the QPL. . LubricantAdhesive Furnish a lubricantadhesive conforming to ASTM D and according to the recommendations of the seal manufacturer. . Steel Bridging Plate Furnish a hotdip galvanized conforming to AASHTO M ASTM A merchant quality steel bridging plate with a minimum thickness of inch and a width of inches cut in lengths of feet or more .
Drill spike holes at inch centers along the centerline of the plate before galvanizing .
Repair galvanization according to ASTM A. . Preformed Joint Seals Furnish compression joint seals conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M . Use strip seals conforming to ASTM D. . Elastomeric Concrete Furnish elastomeric concrete from the QPL . .
Hot Poured Joint Filler Furnish hot poured joint filler from the QPL and conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M Type II ASTM D Type II. . Gaskets for Concrete Pipe and Precast Manhole Section Joints a Preformed Flexible Joint Sealant Furnish Materials for tongue and groove or key lock manhole joints conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM C. b Rubber Gaskets Furnish Materials for Oring manhole and concrete pipe joints conforming to AASHTO M ASTM C. . Joint Materials for Concrete Precast Manhole Section Joints a Mortar Furnish mortar conforming to the requirements of ASTM C or proportioned one part Type II portland cement to two parts clean wellgraded sand passing a No .
screen .
Admixtures may be used not exceeding the following percentages by weight of cement Hydrated lime Diatomaceous earth or other inert materials The consistency of the mortar shall be such that it will readily adhere to the precast concrete if using the standard tongueandgroove type joint. . b NonEpoxy NonShrink Grout Furnish a nonepoxy nonshrink grout according to .. Place or pack nonepoxy nonshrink grouts only with the use of a nonepoxy bonding agent according to .
applied to all cured concrete surfaces being grouted .
Use a bonding agent compatible with the grout used . .
Plastic Compound for Precast Manhole Section Joints Furnish a plastic compound that is specifically manufactured for the intended use and Has a puttylike preformed homogeneous blend of hydrocarbon resins and rubber or plasticizing materials with not more than percent by weight of inert mineral filler .
Is pliable at temperatures between F and F. A specimen at F and inch square in Cross Section shall stretch at least inches before rupture when tested with the apparatus described in ASTM D. Adheres firmly and cohesively to the precast manhole sections when the compoundsealed joint is flexed to its maximum extent .
Includes a primer solution recommended by the compound manufacturer .
Conforms with Federal Specification SSS GSAFSS. . Water Stop Furnish either plastic or rubber water stop as the Contractor elects manufactured to the dimensions shown and meeting the following requirements a Plastic Polyvinyl chloride water stop shall be manufactured from virgin polyvinyl chloride PVC compound .
No reclaimed PVC will be allowed .
The water stop shall have the following properties ASTM Test Specification Test Method Minimum Tensile Strength psi D Elongation D Modulus psi D Low Brittle Temperature D F Cold Bend Test No Failures Samples maintained at F for hours then bent quickly around a inch mandrel to degrees .
b Rubber Manufacture rubber water stop to the dimensions shown in such a manner that the finished product has an integral Cross Section which will be dense homogeneous and free from porosity and other imperfections .
The water stop shall have the following properties Hardness The Shore A Durometer hardness of to when tested according to ASTM D. Elongation Minimum of percent .
Tensile Strength Minimum of psi .
Water Absorption Maximum of percent by weight after immersion in water for days at F. Tensile Strength after Aging The test specimen after accelerated aging of days at F shall retain not less than percent of the original tensile strength .
The tensile .
strength of the test specimen after accelerated aging of hours in oxygen at F and tensile stress of psi shall be not less than percent of the original tensile strength .
Compression Set Not more than percent when tested according to ASTM D method B after hours at F. Specific Gravity .
..
Defects Minor surface defects such as surface peel covering less than square inch surface cavities or bumps less than inch in longest lateral dimensions and less than inch deep will be acceptable . .

Section Manhole and Inlet Materials Descriptions .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for precast manhole sump sections metal frames covers grates and ladders .
Materials .
Precast Concrete Manhole Sections Furnish precast risers cones and cover slabs for precast concrete manholes conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM C. . Precast Concrete Catch Basins and Inlets Furnish precast concrete catch basins and inlet conforming to the requirements of ASTM C. . Precast Concrete Sump Sections Furnish precast rings and lids for precast concrete sumps of portland cement concrete conforming to AASHTO M ASTM C. . Metal Frames Covers Grates and Ladders Comply with the following Projects on State Highways Item AASHTO ASTM Designation Grade Manhole frames and covers M Class B Inlet frames and grates M Class B M A M A A M A Manhole ladder rails M A A M A All Other Projects Item AASHTO ASTM Designation Grade Manhole frames and covers M Class B Inlet frames and grates M A M A A M A Manhole ladder rails M A A M A Fabricate steps for manholes and rungs for manhole ladders from structural steel having a minimum yield strength of psi and galvanized according to AASHTO M ASTM A .
As an alternate steps for manholes may be steelreinforced plastic conforming to AASHTO M ASTM C and AASHTO T ASTM C. The steel shall be deformed reinforcing bar conforming to AASHTO M ASTM A Grade No .
minimum .
The plastic material surrounding the reinforcing steel bar shall be injection molded with a textured nonslip surface and a minimum thickness over the steel of inch .
Voids in the plastic will be cause for rejection of the step. . Welding shall conform to AWS D .. Frames covers and grates for use one with another shall have even and uniform bearings .
Miscellaneous metal items and hardware shall conform to the appropriate requirements of Section . . Damaged Zinc or Aluminum Coating Repair damaged zinc or aluminum coating according to .d . .

and this Section . .
Section Potable Water Pipe Materials Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for ductile iron steel and polyvinyl chloride PVC pipe inches in diameter and smaller for potable water systems .
Materials .
General Clearly mark all pipe with the type class thickness and manufacturers name as applicable .
Lettering shall be legible and permanent under normal conditions of handling and storage .
All materials in contact with potable water shall conform to ANSINSF Standard Drinking Water System Components Health Effects or equivalent and ANSINSF Standard Drinking Water System Components Lead Content. . Ductile Iron Pipe a General Use centrifugally cast ductile iron pipe meeting the requirements of AWWA C. Ductile iron pipe shall have a cementmortar lining and seal coating meeting the requirements of AWWA C. Ductile iron pipe to be joined using bolted flanged joints shall be Special Thickness Class .
All other ductile iron pipe shall be Special Thickness Class unless otherwise shown or specified .
b Nonrestrained Joints Nonrestrained joints shall be rubber gasket pushon type or mechanical type meeting the requirements of AWWA C. Restrained joints shall conform to .. . High Density Polyethylene HDPE Pipe Use HDPE pipe meeting the requirements of ANSIAWWA C Standard Code Designation of PE .
Furnish all pipe with a minimum dimension ratio DR of .
Join pipe using thermal butt fusion method that meets the requirements of ASTM D. . Polyvinyl Chloride PVC Pipe Inches and Larger a PVC Pipe Smaller Than inch Diameter PVC pipe inches in diameter up to but not including inches in diameter shall meet the requirements of AWWA C have the same outside dimensions as ductile iron pipe and have a minimum dimension ratio DR of or as specified or indicated .
b Large Diameter PVC Pipe PVC pipe inches in diameter to inches in diameter shall meet the requirements of AWWA C have the same outside dimensions as ductile iron pipe and have a minimum dimension ratio DR of or as specified or indicated .
c Joints Joints shall meet the requirements of ASTM D using a restrained rubber gasket conforming to ASTM F. Solventwelded pipe joints are not allowed. . Polyvinyl Chloride PVC Pipe Under Inches Polyvinyl chloride PVC under inches in diameter shall meet the requirements of ASTM D. Pipe material shall be PVC PVC or PVC and shall have minimum wall thickness equal to or greater than a standard dimension ratio SDR of or as specified or indicated .
Joints shall meet the requirements of ASTM D using a restrained rubber gasket meeting the requirements of ASTM F. Solvent welded pipe joints will only be allowed when specified or indicated. . Polyethylene Encasement Polyethylene encasement shall conform to AWWA C. . .
Marking Tape and Wire a Marking Tape Marking tape shall consist of inert polyethylene plastic impervious to all known alkalis acids chemical reagents and solvents likely to be encountered in the Soil .
The width of the tape shall be as recommended by the manufacturer for the depth of installation .
The tape shall be blue and imprinted continuously over its entire length in permanent black ink with the words Caution Water .
b Detectable Marking Wire Furnish detectable marking wire with blue colored insulation and according to .. Furnish splice kits according to .. .
Acceptance Ductile iron HDPE and PVC pipe will be accepted according to .
and this Section . .
Section Potable Water Fitting Materials Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for fittings restrained joints and couplings for ductile iron pipe high density polyethylene HDPE pipe and polyvinyl chloride PVC pipe for potable water systems .
Materials .
General Bolts nuts and washers used for securing fittings shall be of similar materials .
Steel bolts shall meet the requirements of ASTM A for carbon steel or ASTM F for stainless steel .
Nuts shall meet the requirements of ASTM A for carbon steel and ASTM F for stainless steel .
Iron bolts and nuts shall meet the requirements of ASTM A grade .
Galvanize carbon steel bolts nuts and washers according to .. All materials in contact with potable water shall conform to ANSINSF Standard Drinking Water System Components Health Effects or equivalent and ANSINSF Standard Drinking Water System Components Lead Content. . Ductile Iron Pipe Fittings Fittings for ductile iron pipe shall meet the requirements of AWWA C or AWWA C and shall have a minimum working pressure rating of psi .
Joints shall meet the requirements of AWWA C. Fittings shall be cement mortar lined and seal coated meeting the requirements of AWWA C. Provide gaskets for ductile iron flanged joints that are composed of synthetic rubber full faced inch thick and conform to ANSIAWWA CA .. Ring gaskets will be permitted only where specified or shown .
The type material and identification mark for bolts and nuts shall be provided. . High Density Polyethylene HDPE Pipe Fittings Use HDPE pipe fittings meeting the requirements of ANSIAWWA C Standard Code Designation of PE .
Furnish all pipe fittings with a minimum dimension ratio DR of .
Join pipe and fittings using a thermal butt fusion method that meets the requirements of ASTM D. Fittings shall be of the same class as the HDPE pipe. . Fittings for Polyvinyl Chloride Pipe Inches and Larger Fittings for PVC pipe inches in diameter and larger shall be the same as specified for ductile iron pipe. . Fittings for Polyvinyl Chloride Pipe Under Inches Fittings for PVC pipe under inches in diameter shall meet the requirements of ASTM D. .
Restrained Joints Restrain pipe fittings and valves by using an approved bolted or boltless system .
Design the restraint system to operate at a working pressure that is greater than the hydrostatic test pressure identified in .a unless otherwise shown .
No device utilizing round point set screws will be allowed .
Restraint systems provided for pipe bells shall be certified for use by the pipe manufacturer. . Bolted SleeveType Couplings for PlainEnd Pipe Bolted sleeve type couplings reducing or transition couplings and flanged coupling adapters used to join plain end pipe shall meet the requirements of AWWA C. Buried couplings used for connecting ductile iron gray cast iron or PVC pipe shall be ductile iron . .
Acceptance Acceptance of fittings restrained joints and couplings will be according to .
and this Section . .
Section Potable Water Valve Materials Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for gate valves butterfly valves valve boxes valve stem extensions tapping sleeve and valve assemblies check valves combination air releaseair vacuum valves and backflow prevention devices for potable water systems .
Materials .
General Provide valves with operating nuts or hand wheels as specified or shown .
Furnish a standard inch operating nut .
All materials in contact with potable water shall conform to ANSINSF Standard Drinking Water System Components Health Effects or equivalent .
When indicated coat all interior and exterior ferrous surfaces of valves with a protective epoxy coating meeting the requirements of AWWA C. . Gate Valves a Minimum Pressure Provide gate valves that meet the requirements of AWWA C AWWA C or AWWA C. The minimum design working pressure shall be psi for pipe inches to inches in diameter and psi for pipe inches to inches in diameter .
b Arrangement For inch diameter pipe arrange gate valves for operation with gear case in the horizontal position .
Equip valves with bypasses and gate valves of the sizes adopted in the AWWA Standards .
Equip bypass gate valves with standard inch operating nuts .
c Valves Provide gate valves that are resilient seat nonrising stem type open counterclockwise and are equipped with an Oring stuffing box. . Butterfly Valves a Seats and Seals Provide butterfly valves that are rubber seated and meet the requirements of AWWA C Class B. Shaft seals shall be standard Oring seals designed for replacement under line pressure .
b Valve Operators Provide valve operators of the traveling nut or worm gear type and that are sealed gasketed and permanently lubricated for buried service .
Construct valve operators to the standard of the valve manufacturer to withstand all anticipated operating torques and design to resist submergence in groundwater .
c Valves Provide butterfly valves that are resilient seat open counterclockwise and are equipped with an O ring stuffing box . .
Valve Boxes Install valve boxes on all buried valves .
Boxes shall be of cast iron twopiece slip type standard design with a base corresponding to the size of the valve .
The cover shall have the word WATER cast in it . .
Valve Stem Extensions Valve stem extensions shall have a inch square operating nut and selfcentering rockplate support .
Valves with an operating nut more than feet below grade shall have a valve stem extension to raise the operating nut to within feet of the ground surface . .
Tapping Sleeve and Valve Assemblies a Valve Assemblies Furnish tapping valves with flanged inlet end connections .
The outlet ends shall conform in dimensions to the AWWA Standards for mechanical joint connections or .
flange connections except that the outside of the end connection shall have a large flange for attaching a drilling machine .
The seat opening of the valve shall permit a diameter cut no less than inch smaller than the valve size .
Valves specifically designed for tapping meeting the requirements of AWWA C and valves meeting the requirements of AWWA C will be allowed .
Tapping valves shall be of the same type as other valves on the Project .
b Sleeves Tapping sleeves shall be cast iron ductile iron stainless steel epoxy coated steel or other approved Material . .
Check Valves Check valves shall conform to the following a Swing Check Valve Swing check valves shall meet the requirements of AWWA C with rubber seat materials mating with metal seating surfaces .
The minimum design working pressure shall be psi for check valves with diameters of inches and smaller and psi for check valves with diameters of inches and inches .
Check valves shall be nonassisted unless otherwise indicated .
b SpringLoaded Plug or Disc Check Valves Springloaded plug or disc check valves shall be bronze mounted with bronze cast or ductile iron body bronze plug or disc stainless steel spring and resilient seating suitable for potable water service .
The valves shall provide droptight sealing .
The plugs or discs shall be easily replaceable .
The minimum design working pressure of the valves shall be psi . .
Combination Air ReleaseAir Vacuum Valves Furnish combination air releaseair vacuum valves that meet the requirements of AWWA C. The valve body shall have a minimum design working pressure of psi .
The body and cover shall be cast iron conforming to ASTM A Class .
Floats shall be stainless steel conforming to ASTM A and designed to withstand psi .
Seats shall be BunaN rubber .
Internal parts shall be stainless steel or bronze. . Backflow Prevention Devices Backflow prevention devices shall be capable of withstanding a minimum design working pressure of psi and shall conform to the following a Reduced Pressure Backflow Prevention Assembly Reduced pressure backflow prevention assemblies shall consist of a mechanical independently operating hydraulically dependent relief valve located between two independently operating spring loaded check valves that are located between two tightly closing resilient seated shutoff valves with four resilient seated test cocks all meeting the requirements of AWWA C and the Oregon State Health Division .
b Double Detector Check Valve Backflow Prevention Assembly Double detector check valve backflow prevention assemblies shall consist of two spring loaded independently operating check valves located between two tightly closing resilient seated shutoff valves with four resilient seated test cocks all meeting the requirements of AWWA C and the Oregon State Health Division . .
Acceptance Valves and appurtenances will be accepted according to .
and this Section . .
Section Hydrant and Appurtenance Materials Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for hydrants and hydrant appurtenances for potable water systems .
Materials .
Hydrants Furnish hydrants that are drybarrel conforming to AWWA C of standard manufacture and of a pattern approved by the Agency .
Hydrants shall be designed for a minimum working pressure of psi .
All materials in contact with potable water shall conform to ANSINSF Standard Drinking Water System Components Health Effects or equivalent. . End Connections The end connections shall be mechanical joint or flanged meeting the requirements of AWWA C and AWWA C. . Hydrant Dimensions and Nozzle Features a Hydrant Dimensions Barrels shall have a inch minimum inside diameter .
Hydrant length measured from the bottom of the hydrant to the sidewalk ring shall provide proper cover at each installed location .
Valve openings shall have a minimum diameter of inches .
b Nozzle Features Hydrants shall have two inch diameter hose nozzles and one pumper nozzle to match the Agencys connection requirements .
Fit nozzles with cast iron threaded caps with operating nuts of the same design and proportions as the hydrant stem nuts .
Thread caps to fit the corresponding nozzles and fit with suitable neoprene gaskets of positive water tightness under test pressures .
The direction of opening shall be counterclockwise and shall be clearly marked on the operating nut or hydrant top .
Hydrants shall have Oring stem seals .
Interior and exterior painting of the hydrant shall conform to AWWA C. . Hydrant Extensions Hydrant extensions shall be gray cast iron or ductile iron with an inside diameter of at least inches and shall conform to the AWWA Standards for such castings .
The drillings of the connecting flanges on the extensions shall match the drillings of the flanges on the hydrant .
Hydrant extensions shall also include the necessary hydrant operating stem extensions. . Traffic Flange Provide hydrants with a traffic flange .
Hydrants shall be equipped with breaking devices at the traffic flange which will allow the hydrant barrel to separate at this point with a minimum breakage of hydrant parts in case of damage .
Also provide at this point a safety stem coupling on the operating stem that will shear upon impact . .
Tie Rods Tie rods shall be inch diameter with threaded ends galvanized according to .
and conforming to .. .
Acceptance Acceptance of hydrants and hydrant appurtenances will be according to .
and this Section . .
Section Potable Water Service Connection Materials Inch and Smaller Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for potable water service connections inches in diameter and smaller and sampling stations .
Materials .
General Service line materials shall conform to AWWA C and these Specifications .
Provide service line materials that are designed for a working pressure of psi .
Where high pressure service materials are specified or shown provide materials that are designed for a working pressure of psi .
Use high pressure service materials when service line is hydrostatically tested concurrent with the water main .
All materials in contact with potable water shall conform to ANSINSF Standard Drinking Water System Components Health Effects or equivalent. . Saddles Saddles shall be ductile iron bronze or stainless steel .
Saddles used for inch and inch services shall be single strap saddles and have either AWWA tapered thread or female iron pipe thread outlet .
Saddles used for inch and inch services shall be double strap saddles with female iron pipe thread outlet .
Saddles used on asbestos cement or on PVC pipe shall be formed for the pipe and have flat stainless steel straps. . Service Connection Valves a Corporation Stops Corporation stops shall be constructed of bronze alloy .
Corporation stops for direct tapping shall have AWWA tapered thread inlet and outlet connections compatible with either copper or polyethylene tubing .
Less Than or Equal to Inch Corporation stops used with inch and inch outlet saddles shall have either AWWA tapered thread or male iron pipe thread inlets and outlet connections compatible with either copper or polyethylene tubing .
Thread patterns for the saddle outlet and corporation stop inlet shall be the same .
Greater Than Inch Corporation stops used with inch and inch outlet saddles shall have male iron pipe thread inlets and outlet connections compatible with connecting service pipes or have male iron pipe thread outlets .
b Angle Meter Valves Angle meter valves shall meet the requirements of ASTM B .
All angle meter valves shall have a lock wing .
c Customer Service Valves Customer service valves shall be bronze straight gate valves or angled gate valves on all services smaller than inch and shall be nonrising stem solid disc type with screwed or union bonnet threaded ends and a have brass handle .
Body bonnet operating handle and disc shall be ASTM B bronze .
Stems shall be copper silicon alloy nickel plated steel or other approved corrosion resistant materials with equal characteristics of strength and durability .
The disc shall clear the port area completely in the fully opened position .
Threaded ends shall meet the requirements of ANSI B .. . Service Pipe and Fittings a Copper Tubing Service Pipe Copper tubing service pipe shall be annealed seamless tubing conforming to the requirements of ASTM B Type K. b Polyethylene Tubing Service Pipe Polyethylene tubing service pipe shall meet the requirements of AWWA C. Tubing shall be high molecular mass with a psi rating . .
Tubing used for inch and inch shall be either SDR iron pipe size or SDR copper tube size .
Tubing used for inch and inch shall be SDR copper tube size .
c Service Fittings Make fittings used for service connections of bronze alloy .
Fittings used for copper tubing shall be either compression or flare type insulated or noninsulated .
Fittings used for polyethylene tubing shall be either compression or stab type .
Stab type fittings shall utilize an internal grip ring and Oring seal .
Use stainless steel liners when utilizing compression fittings on polyethylene tubing . .
Meter Setters Meter setters shall be manufactured and tested according to all applicable parts of AWWA C. Meter setters shall be inches in height and shall have an angle meter stop with drilled padlock wing an angle check valve and inlet and outlet threads compatible with fittings connecting to service pipes .
Meter setters for inch by inch inch and inch services shall have meter saddle nuts for installation and removal of the meter .
Meter setters for inch and inch services shall be equipped with a locking bypass . .
Bronze Nipples and Fittings Bronze threaded nipples and fittings shall meet the requirements of ANSI B. ASA pound class . .
Meter Boxes a Nontraffic Areas Construct meter boxes and covers located in the nontraffic areas of either reinforced concrete or high density polyethylene .
High density polyethylene meter boxes and covers shall have a tensile strength conforming to ASTM D. Meter box covers shall include a reading lid .
b Traffic Areas Construct meter boxes located in traffic areas of either reinforced concrete cast iron or ductile iron .
Construct traffic covers of aluminum steel cast iron or ductile iron .
Meter boxes and covers shall be designed for continuous H traffic loading. . Sampling Stations Sampling stations shall have a inch inlet with the depth of bury indicated and a inch unthreaded nozzle .
Enclose the sampling station in a lockable nonremovable cast aluminum housing .
When opened the station shall require no key for operation and the water shall flow in an allbrass waterway .
All working parts shall also be of brass and be removable from above ground with no digging .
Exterior piping shall be brass .
Include at each station a copper vent tube with a ball valve to enable the station to be pumped free of standing water to prevent freezing . .
Acceptance Materials for potable water service connections will be accepted according to .
and this Section . .
Structures Section Reinforcement Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for bars dowels and strand reinforcement and tendon ducts .
Materials .
Deformed Bar Reinforcement Furnish deformed bar reinforcement from the QPL and conforming to the requirements of ASTM A AASHTO M ASTM A or AASHTO MP ASTM A .
Unless otherwise specified or shown all reinforcing bars shall be Grade . . Epoxy Coated Reinforcement a Plant Certification Epoxy coating shall be applied in a coating plant certified by the Concrete Reinforcing Steel Institute CRSI .
b Handling All systems for handling coated bars shall have padded contact areas for the bars wherever feasible .
Pad all bundling bands .
Lift all bundles with strongbacks multiple supports or platform bridges so as to prevent bartobar abrasion from sags in the bar bundle .
c Coated Reinforcement Ties and Supports Ties for coated reinforcement including ties for coatedtouncoated reinforcement connections shall be nonmetallic coated .
d Epoxy Coating Repair Repair damaged areas and visible voids according to .. .
Mechanical Splices Mechanical splices for reinforcing bars are systems which connect the bars without raising their temperature above F. Provide mechanical splices from the QPL that develop at least the specified tensile strength or percent of the specified minimum yield strength of the reinforcing bars in tension whichever is less .
Where bars of different sizes or strengths are connected the governing strength shall be the strength of the smaller or weaker bar .
The total slip of reinforcing bars within a splice sleeve shall not exceed .
inch measured between gauge points clear of the splice sleeve when the reinforcing bars are loaded in tension to percent of the specified minimum yield strength of the reinforcing bar . .
Headed Bar Reinforcement Furnish Class HA headed steel bar from the QPL for concrete reinforcement .
The headed steel bar shall develop the specified minimum tensile strength of the reinforcing bars according to ASTM A. Ferrousfiller coupling sleeves forged headed steel bars and welded headed steel bars are not allowed for concrete reinforcement. . Galvanized Reinforcement a General Galvanized reinforcement shall conform to the requirements of ASTM A Class II including Supplementary Requirement S and ASTM A. b Fabrication The bars may be fabricated before or after galvanizing .
If the bars are fabricated after galvanizing Supplementary Requirements S and S of ASTM A shall apply .
c Handling All systems for handling galvanized bars shall be according to .c. . d Ties and Supports Tie all mats of galvanized steel bars with galvanized ties .
Precast concrete blocks that support galvanized reinforcement shall have galvanized ties. . Welded Wire Reinforcement Welded wire reinforcement and deformed welded wire reinforcement shall conform to the requirements of ASTM A. . Dowels Dowels shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A for Grades and or AASHTO M ASTM A for Grades and . . Wire Reinforcement Wire reinforcement and deformed wire reinforcement shall conform to the requirements of ASTM A. .
Acceptance Acceptance of reinforcement will be according to .
and this Section . .
Section Prestressing Reinforcement Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for sevenwire strand high tensile strength wire high tensile strength steel alloy bars tendon duct and couplings .
Materials .
SevenWire Strand Sevenwire strand bright wire shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A Grade supplement low relaxation strand minimum ultimate strength psi. . Wire High Tensile Strength High tensile strength wire shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A. .
Bars High Tensile Strength High strength steel bars shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A. . SevenWire Strand Epoxy Coated Reinforcement Epoxy coated reinforcement shall conform to the requirements of ASTM A. . Tendon Duct Provide rigid galvanized steel ducts conforming to the requirements of ASTM A with a coating weight of G for posttensioned Structures .
Transition couplings connecting rigid ducts in anchoring devices need not be galvanized .
Rigid ducts may be fabricated with either welded or interlocking seams .
Galvanizing of the welded seam is not required .
Provide ducts with sufficient strength to maintain their correct alignment during placing of concrete and resist denting during construction .
Minimum wall thickness of ducts shall be gauge for inch diameter and smaller ducts and gauge for ducts that are larger than inch diameter. . Couplings Provide couplings that develop at least percent of the minimum specified ultimate strength of the prestressing steel without exceeding anticipated set .
The coupling of tendons shall not reduce the elongation at rupture below the requirements of the tendon itself . .
Shipping Protection Package prestressing steel to protect the steel against physical damage and corrosion .
Place a corrosion inhibitor that prevents rust or other results of corrosion in the package or use a corrosion inhibitor type packaging material or when allowed apply directly to the steel .
Provide a corrosion inhibitor that has no deleterious effect on the steel or concrete or bond strength of steel to concrete .
Immediately replace or restore damaged packaging .
Mark the shipping package with the type of corrosion inhibitor used and the date packaged . .
Acceptance Acceptance of prestressing reinforcement will be according to .
and this Section . .
Section Steel and Concrete Piles Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for steel pipe steel Hbeams steel sheets and prestressed concrete used for piling .
Materials .
Steel Piles a General All steel piles except steel pipe piles shall meet the requirements for Camber and sweep specified in AASHTO M ASTM A. b Steel Pipe Piles Steel pipe piles shall be either spirally welded or longitudinally welded constant in section and conforming to ASTM A Grade or or API L X or X. Seal tips with a inch thick steel plate or an approved cast steel point welded in place when specified .
Concrete used to fill steel pipe pile shall be Class or .
c Steel HPiles Steel Hpiles shall be rolled steel pile sections of the size and weight shown .
Steel shall conform to the requirements of ASTM A or ASTM A Grade .
The manufacturers name brand or trademark may be shown by die stamping in the web at intervals not exceeding feet along the length of the pile .
d Steel Sheet Piles Steel sheet piles shall conform to AASHTO M ASTM A. e Reinforced Pile Tips Steel pile tip reinforcement includes Hpile points pipe pile shoes or points or any other proprietary steel pile tip reinforcement .
Legibly mark or tag each cast steel point or shoe delivered to the Project Site with the heat or lot number .
Submit certified mill test reports showing the physical and chemical properties of each heat or lot number .
If the heat or lot number can not be read on the point or if the mark or tag is missing the point or shoe will be rejected .
Provide reinforced tips for steel Hpiles from the QPL .
In addition all cast steel points or shoes shall conform to the following ASTM A Grade ASTM A Grade ASTM A Grade ASTM A all grades For steel Hpiles provide no less than a inch fillet weld full width of each flange .
f Sampling and Field Testing Pile Tips The Engineer may randomly sample from each heat or lot number at least one pile tip or up to percent of the tips for larger projects of the pile tips delivered for incorporation into the Project .
The selected tips shall be tested as follows Grind five smooth spots on each randomly selected tip .
The Engineer will test each smooth spot on each tip with a portable hardness tester or in a laboratory .
If three or more of the five spots tested have a reading below on the B scale the tested tip and the entire lot shall be rejected. . For steel Hpiles determine the weight of the tips .
Each cast steel Hpile point shall have a weight not less than percent of the weight of a foot section of the Hpile to which it will be attached .
If any of the tested tips fail to pass the minimum weight criteria the entire lot shall be rejected .
Pile tips that are supplied unattached to the pile may be selected for nondestructive testing as described above .
Pile tips passing the field test may be incorporated into the Project .
Pile tips selected for testing that are supplied already attached to the pile will be destructively tested as determined by the Engineer .
Provide replacement tips for the tips that are destructively tested at no cost to the Agency .
Replace rejected tips with new tips and rejected lots with new lots at no additional cost to the Agency .
No time extension or other compensation will be granted for materials or Work required in testing pile tips replacing rejected pile tips or for replacing tips that are destructively tested .
New tips and new lots may also be tested according to the requirements above. . Prestressed Concrete Piles a General Prestressed concrete piles shall be manufactured according to Section and as shown .
b Concrete Concrete in precast prestressed piles shall be Class or .
Minimum concrete strength at transfer of prestressing force shall be psi .
Concrete in pile extensions or buildups shall be Class or .
c Prestressing Reinforcement Prestressing reinforcement steel shall consist of sevenwire lowrelaxation strands conforming to .. d Mild Steel Reinforcement Spiral reinforcement shall be plain reinforcing steel meeting the requirements of .
or colddrawn wire meeting the requirements of .. All other mild reinforcing steel shall meet the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A Grade .
e Forms The use of steel forms on concrete founded casting beds is required .
Forms shall enclose all except the top horizontal surface and shall be mortartight .
Forms for piles shall not cause the formation of fins at the intersection of surfaces .
f Tolerances The maximum sweep deviation of straightness measured along two perpendicular faces of the pile while not subject to bending forces shall not exceed inch in any feet of length inch in feet or inch x total length in feet per feet .
g Finish The tops of concrete castings shall be given a uniformly smooth finish to match the finish surface of the formed sides . .
Acceptance Material for piles will be accepted according to .
and this Section . .
Section Structural Steel Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for structural steel used in the fabrication of Bridges and nonBridge Structures .
Materials .
Structural Steel for Bridges Structural steel for Bridges shall conform to the following as shown or specified AASHTO M Grade ASTM A Grade AASHTO M Grade ASTM A Grade AASHTO M Grade W ASTM A Grade W AASHTO M Grade HPS ASTM A Grade HPS AASHTO M Grade HPS W ASTM A Grade HPS W Supplementary Requirement S AASHTO M ASTM A FractureCritical F Material Toughness Testing and Marking is mandatory for all fracture critical steel .
Toughness requirements for all areas of Oregon shall be according to Zone requirements .
Supplementary Requirement S Limitation on Weld Repair is mandatory for all fracture critical steel .
Supplementary Requirement S Product Analysis of AASHTO M ASTM A is mandatory for all steel plate that will be welded .
The product analysis shall be on a heat frequency .
It shall include all elements listed in Table A of AASHTO M ASTM A regardless of the material specification except that nitrogen need not be reported unless specified in the product specification .
The product analysis shall be submitted to the Engineer immediately upon receipt of the steel . .
Structural Steel for NonBridge Structures Structural steel for metal sign Structures and other nonBridge Structures shall conform to the following or as shown or specified AASHTO M Grade ASTM A Grade ASTM A AASHTO M Grade ASTM A Grade ASTM A Notch toughness of all structural steel members and plates greater than inch thick in load carrying members of sign Bridges and cantilever sign supports shall conform to Zone requirements of AASHTO M . . Ultrasonic Inspection of Plate Ultrasonically inspect flanges inches and thicker for welded plate girders before fabrication according to ASTM A except as follows Section Acceptance Standard Level A and Section Acceptance Standard Level B do not apply .
Use Supplementary Requirement S. for acceptance standard .
Inspection of flanges of rolled shapes with flanges thicker than inches. . Universal Mill Plate Universal mill plate shall not be used .
. .
Rolled Shapes With the approval of the Engineer rolled shapes having equal or greater section properties and meeting minimum flange and web thickness requirements may be substituted for members specified on the Plans at no additional cost to the Agency. . Galvanizing Galvanizing shall be by the hotdip process according to the following as applicable AASHTO M ASTM A AASHTO M ASTM A Steel that will be finished by hotdip galvanizing for use as sign Bridges illumination poles traffic signal poles sign supports bridge rail and items designated on the Plans as Galvanize Control Silicon shall have controlled silicon content .
The silicon content shall be in either of the ranges .
percent or .
percent .
percent .
Before galvanizing submit mill test certificates verifying silicon content to the Engineer and the galvanizer. . Repair of HotDip Galvanizing Repair damaged hotdip galvanizing according to ASTM A and ASTM A. Furnish galvanizing repair Material from the QPL .
Minimum dry film thickness is mils .
Minimum zinc content for Method A is percent on the dry film . .
