c Submittals Before beginning LED luminaire installation submit the following according to .
for review by the Engineer Four copies of LED luminaire manufacturers data sheets including light source drivers surge protection device and installation instructions .
For the dimmable LED driver specified diagrams illustrating light output and input power as a function of control signal .
IES LM luminaire photometric reports produced by the test laboratory that satisfy LED Lighting Facts accreditation requirements .
Reports shall include the name of the laboratory report number date luminaire catalog number luminaire description and BacklightUplightGlare BUG ratings .
Lumen maintenance calculations and supporting data shall be in accordance with LED Lighting Facts guidance .
Computer generated photometric analysis and calculation of maintained light levels shall be in accordance with IES RP Roadway Lighting .
Use a Light Loss Factor LLF of .
or less according to the individual luminaire test report data .
Do not use the Mesopic multipliers of effective luminance factors for calculation .
IES format electronic file containing luminous intensity data associated with submitted LM reports and used for pointbypoint calculations .
Within Calendar Days after receipt of submittals the Engineer will review the submittals and approved approved as noted or returned for correction .
Do not begin LED Luminaire installation before receiving written approval of submittals from the Engineer. . Blank Page .
PART MATERIALS Section Fencing Materials Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for barbed wire woven wire and chain link fabric metal posts braces hardware and gates .
Materials .
Barbed Wire The barbed wire shall be twostrand and either gauge or gauge with fourpoint barbs spaced at inch intervals conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A. Galvanizing shall be Class .
All barbed wire installed on the Project shall be new or like new and the same diameter unless otherwise approved. . Woven Wire Fabric The woven wire fabric shall be gauge galvanized steel wire conforming to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A Class coating or gauge or gauge aluminum coated steel wire conforming to the applicable requirements of ASTM A .
The gauge aluminum coated steel wire shall have the same coating thickness required for gauge steel wire in Table of ASTM A. . Chain Link Fabric Ties and Tension Wire Chain link fabric ties and tension wire shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M supplemented and modified as follows Fabric may be zinccoated steel meeting Type I Class D coating requirement aluminum coated steel or aluminum alloy .
Use only one type on the Project .
Wire fabric ties wire ties and hog rings may be zinccoated steel wire aluminumcoated steel or aluminum alloy as elected regardless of the type of wire fabric used .
Use ductile zinccoated steel meeting the coating requirements of ASTM A Class for wire fabric ties wire ties and hog rings .
Aluminumcoated steel wire fabric ties wire ties and hog rings shall be coated with at least .
ounce per square foot .
Tension wire shall have a Class coating .
Fabric for the fence to be installed with pickets shall be gauge wire woven in inch by inch diamond mesh .
Top and bottom selvage shall be knuckled finish . .
Pickets Pickets shall be either standard Grade A redwood or cedar pickets inch x inch x feet or industry standard metal or plastic pickets as shown or approved. . Vinyl Clad Fabric Vinyl clad chain link fabric shall conform to AASHTO M Type IV .
The color of the PVC coating shall be either medium or dark green. . Metal Fence Posts Braces and Appurtenances Metal fence posts braces and appurtenances shall conform to the requirements indicated on the Plans and the following a Painted Metal Posts All painted metal posts shall be of the same kind and color .
b Posts Braces and Appurtenances for Chain Link Fence Posts braces and appurtenances for chain link fence shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M . . Posts for bridge protective fence shall be galvanized and conform to the requirements of ASTM A Grade B .
Braces and appurtenances for bridge protective fence shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M . c Posts Braces and Appurtenances for Barbed Wire and Woven Wire Fence Tubular Steel Posts Tubular steel posts braces and appurtenances shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M . Tubular posts shall be fitted with a snugfitting galvanized metal cap .
Other Shapes Metal posts and braces other than tubular shape for barbed wire and woven wire fences shall conform to AASHTO M ASTM A except that galvanizing may conform to the requirements of AASHTO M ASTM A .
The posts and braces may be either galvanized or painted as elected .
Wire fasteners shall meet the coating requirements of ASTM A Class .
Fence Stays Brace Guys and Wire Loops Metal fence stays brace guy wires wire loops for gateways and other miscellaneous wire used in barbed and woven wire fences shall be furnished with Class coating as required by ASTM A .
Either gauge or gauge wire is acceptable for fence stays .
d Concrete In Footings Concrete for footings shall conform to Section .
e Grounding Rod inch by feet nonrusting copper covered steel rod with a bronze grounding wire clamp .
f Grounding Wire AWG Solid Copper or No .
bare aluminum wire with clamps . .
Fence Gates a General Tubular steel gate frames shall conform to AASHTO M . Fabric in gates used with chain link fence shall be chain link of the same gauge and conforming to applicable requirements of ..
Fabric in gates used with woven wire fence shall be woven wire fabric conforming to .
or chain link fabric conforming to the applicable requirements of .
except that the zinc coating may be either Class C or Class D. b Hardware All fence and gate hardware shall conform to the requirements of AASHTO M except that the thickness of galvanizing shall be according to AASHTO M ASTM A. .
Protective Fence Materials On and Off Structures Provide certification according to the requirements of .
that the anchor system selected conforms to requirements shown on the Plans .
Resin Bonded Anchor System The resin bonded anchor system used to install the fence post anchor rods in the concrete bridge rail shall be from the QPL and be installed according to the manufacturers recommendations .
Posts Modify posts to attach to the Structure as shown .

Section Erosion Materials Description .
Scope This Section includes the requirements for erosion control Materials .
Materials .
Commercially Manufactured Compost Furnish commercially manufactured compost that Is processed through thermophilic composting meeting the EPAs definition of Process to Further Reduce Pathogens .
Is from a commercial compost facility that holds a current DEQ composting permit or is registered with DEQ as a composting facility .
Meets the requirements of the US Composting Council USCC and its Seal of Testing Assurance STA program .
Contains a minimum percent by volume of the following recycled plant waste Sourceseparated yard and garden wastes Wood wastes Agricultural crop residues Waxcoated cardboard Preconsumer vegetative food wastes Other similar sourceseparated materials that the DEQ has determined to have a comparable low level of risk in hazardous substances human pathogens and physical contaminants .
Manure or biosolids based composts when approved .
Meets the following compost particle size and media parameters Compost Particle Size Compost Type Sieve Size Fine Medium Coarse Percent Passing By Dry Weight maximum inch particle length maximum inch particle length .
Media Parameters Test Test Method Requirements Physical Contaminants TMECC .A Less than .
Organic Matter TMECC .A Minimum pH TMECC .A .
to .
Soluble Salt Concentration TMECC .A dSm Maximum Total Carbon Total Nitrogen TMECC .D TMECC .D CarbonNitrogen Ratio Fine Medium Coarse Stability TMECC .B Maturity TMECC .A or Greater Moisture Content TMECC .A Wet Weight Manmade Inert Test Methods for Evaluation of Compost and Composting .
Acceptance Acceptance of commercially manufactured compost Material will be the following Quality compliance certification according to ..
Copies of STA lab analysis .
Copy of DEQ permit or registration of the compost producer .
